input_source_clips: Path to the folder containing your input video clips (MP4, AVI, MOV, MKV).
input_source_clips_folder: Browse for a folder containing multiple video clips to process in batch.
input_source_clips_file: Select a single video clip file to process.
input_depth_maps: Path to the folder containing your pre-rendered depth maps. Depth maps should be named 'videoname_depth.mp4' matching your input videos.
input_depth_maps_folder: Browse for a folder containing corresponding depth maps (e.g., video_name_depth.mp4/npz) for batch processing.
input_depth_maps_file: Select a single depth map file corresponding to the selected source video.
output_splatted: Path to the folder where the splatted output videos will be saved.
enable_full_res: When checked, will generate a splatted video at the original resolution of the input video. Use this for blending over the inpaint.
full_res_batch_size: The number of frames to process simultaneously when generating the full-resolution output. A higher value uses more VRAM but can be faster. Adjust based on your GPU's memory.
enable_low_res: When checked, will generate a splatted video of specified resolution. Use this for inpainting.
low_res_width: The target width for the low-resolution output. The input video and depth maps will be resized to this width for the low-resolution pass.
low_res_height: The target height for the low-resolution output. The input video and depth maps will be resized to this height for the low-resolution pass.
low_res_batch_size: The number of frames to process simultaneously when generating the low-resolution output. Can often be higher than the full-resolution batch size due to lower memory requirements.
dual_output: If checked, will generate dual panel for inpaint right eye only. Unchecked will generate quad panel for complete low-res stereo SBS after inpainting. Use this(Dual) to save on resources and manual blending.
process_length: Set how many frames to process before moving on to the next video, used for testing. Set -1 to process all frames.
output_crf: Constant Rate Factor (CRF) for H.264/H.265 video encoding. Lower values mean higher quality and larger file sizes. A good starting point is 18 for high quality, 23 for good quality. Range is typically 0-51.
auto_convergence_toggle: EXPERIMENTAL: Simple auto convergence derived from 75% center region and averaged or peak throughout the clip.
depth_dilate_size_x: Horizontal Dilate for the Depthhmask. Must be an odd number (3, 5, 7, etc.) or 0 to disable.
depth_dilate_size_y: Vertical Dilate for the Depthhmask. Must be an odd number (3, 5, 7, etc.) or 0 to disable.
depth_blur_size_x: Horizontal Blur for the Depthhmask. Must be an odd number (3, 5, 7, etc.) or 0 to disable. Sigma is automatically calculated as Size/6.
depth_blur_size_y: Vertical Blur for the Depthhmask. Must be an odd number (3, 5, 7, etc.) or 0 to disable. Sigma is automatically calculated as Size/6.
depth_gamma: Applies a non-linear adjustment to the depth map before normalization. above 1.0 moves the midground towards the camera. Below 1.0 move further away. Set to 1.0 to disable.
max_disp: Maximum disparity value as a percentage of the video's width x 20. Higher values result in more extreme parallax effects (depth shift). Example: '30.0' means a maximum of 1.5% shift horizontally at the forground.
convergence_point: Set to 1.0 will place depth inside the screen. 0.0 will give 100% pop out. StereoCrafter Default = 0.5, Recommend 0.8.
no_normalization: Use this only if your scene is too long and you have split your video/depthmap into shorter lengths to be rejoined after processing. Otherwise your cut scenes depth will not align
move_to_finished_folder: When enabled, will move source input files to finished folder after processing.
override_sidecar_preview: If sidecar file exist, it will be displayed with those settings, This checkbox will allow you to override and save/edit your current settings
start_single_button: Start performs the depth splatting on current preview clip.
start_button: Starts the batch processing: loads videos, depth maps, and performs the depth splatting.
stop_button: Stops the currently running processing task cleanly.
preview_auto_converge: Runs the Auto-Convergence pre-pass on the current preview clip. The calculated value overrides the Convergence Point slider. Requires Auto-Convergence Mode to be 'Average' or 'Peak'.
update_sidecar_button: Saves/Edit the current depth setting to the to the sidecar file for inpainting_gui to process.
